description: A small to medium parakeet with a bright green body and a distinctive red crown and forehead stripe. They are native to New Zealand and are known for their constant motion.
temperament: Extremely active, curious, and playful. They are constantly chattering and moving, and are known for their comical antics. They are generally not aggressive.
loudness: Moderate. They have a continuous, goat-like chatter that is not overly loud but is very persistent.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Can learn some words but are not known as exceptional talkers. They prefer to chatter in their own language.
dietaryNeeds: A varied diet including pellets, seeds, fresh vegetables, fruits, and even insects. They enjoy foraging on the ground.
healthPointers: Generally hardy but need experienced care as they are still relatively uncommon in captivity. Can live 12-15 years. Their high activity level means they need a lot of space.
housing: A large flight cage with plenty of room for ground foraging is essential. Bar spacing should be 1/2 inch. They need multiple perch levels and many toys.
